intro: Thalictrum fissum var. greeneanum, commonly known as the Greene's meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, upright stem and produces numerous stamens, which are a notable botanical feature. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
